abstracts.cdata!:
The Fishery Development Project was
            designed to address the ecological and environmental issues
            arising from over-fishing and the use of destructive and
            unsustainable fishing methods. There are two major project
            activities that may potentially present risks to the
            environmental and ecology: a) the larger-scale aquaculture
            activities for Koran, and high-value marine species; and b)
            construction works for the rehabilitation of the fishing
            ports. The construction of the quays at Shengjin and Saranda
            will entail the loss of both intertidal habitat and bottom
            habitat. The loss will be kept down to bare minimum with
            good construction site management. Pollution of the aquatic
            environment from increased vessel operations may be
            mitigated by setting up waste reception facilities for each
            operation separately. Port facilities will be equipped with
            an oily water separator and suction pump. Special
            receptacles will be provided inside the same port areas for
            the disposal of used engine oil that will then be collected
            by authorized collector for proper disposal. Receptacles
            will also be provided for hazardous solid wastes. Skips or
            enclosed dumping enclosures will be provided for the
            disposal of large objects. Airtight PVC containers will be
            provided in areas where wet fish wastes will be produced.
            Refueling of vessels will be done in accordance with
            internationally accepted standards. Wet wastes and
            polystyrene foam from single-use fish boxes will be disposed
            of by receptacles.
